definitions.definition: The total amount of something; quantity .

subdefinitions.definition: The amount of compensation awarded to a successful party in a lawsuit .
The length or magnitude of the sentence handed down to someone who has been found guilty of a crime.

labels: now chiefly South Asia or law
definitions.label_groups: now chiefly South Asia or law

definitions.definition: The amount or quantity observably present , or available .
The smallest possible , and therefore indivisible , unit of a given quantity or quantifiable phenomenon .
The amount of time allocated for a thread to perform its work in a multithreaded environment .

examples: Developing for quantum has never been more accessible.

definitions.definition: The minimum dose of a pathogen required to cause an infection .
A definite portion of a manifoldness , limited by a mark or by a boundary.

main_definition: ( now chiefly South Asia or law ) The total amount of something; quantity . [from 17th c.]
secondary_definitions: The amount or quantity observably present , or available . [from 18th c.]
( physics ) The smallest possible , and therefore indivisible , unit of a given quantity or quantifiable phenomenon . [from 20th c.]
( computing ) The amount of time allocated for a thread to perform its work in a multithreaded environment .
( computing , uncountable ) Ellipsis of quantum computing .
( medicine ) The minimum dose of a pathogen required to cause an infection .
( mathematics ) A definite portion of a manifoldness , limited by a mark or by a boundary.
